recipes: There was a wood. A light. A house without walls -
Every night, I'm closer, but every day, the dreams curl to ash. It's useless. I have work to do, if I want to eat.
There was once a man who said that the sleep of reason produced monsters.

A dream: in the breathy hush of a summer night, a tree hangs heavy with  fruit. Each glows topaz or rose, brighter than a fire-fly, dimmer than a lamp. I could dissect one; I could consume one; or I could watch the moths flutter and the tree sway, enjoy the heady brush of the breeze.
The dawn will come, and I won't hasten it. Each fruit is an eye, but each eye is closed.

A dream: the stained glass of my life, in a series of windows. Here I'm born, pink and appalling. Over there, I'll die. The sunlight slants to brighten the white boards of the floor with colour. Elsewhere they're pale as bone. A curious dreamer might lift them. A savage dreamer might smash the glass. Most would examine their life in  windows.
They've shown my birth in the red church and my death where the woods turn white. The longer I look at the panes between, the brighter the sun.
The sun is rising. It won't spare me.

Now I can slough off my flesh, patch by patch, tugging the tendons free like fibres picked from teeth. My skin lies like a shredded blanket. The sun heaves itself above the horizon with a triumphant battle-yell. The light falls like acid on my naked bones.
Hersault wrote of this: to be compressed in a dank and musty space.
I've levered up floor-boards, and wriggled down snugly. Now I am compressed beneath them like a hidden corpse. The air stinks of hot dust. My mouth is full of splinters. But this is the space below.
Reconsider my goal of unearthly power
Is power really what I want?
Power is of the world.  My predecessor knew secrets beyond the skin of the world. If only I could follow in their footsteps.
Reconsider my goal of unearthly knowledge
Is power really what I want?
Knowledge is a bagatelle. My predecessor knew of powers that generals and kings would envy. If only I could follow in their footsteps.
